title: Mother and Child
medium: pen and ink, brush and ink on card
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Yasuo Kuniyoshi [1893-1953], Woodstock, NY; The Downtown Gallery, Inc., New York, NY, by June 1948; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, 1948 until November 1, 1951 [1]; their gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1951 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The Beals purchased the work from The Downtown Gallery in 1948 for $250; see "The Beal Collection of American Art," Carnegie Museum of Art, 1994, p. 97.
[2]. The drawing was delivered to Carnegie Institute in April 1951 (see list of possible gifts offered to Carnegie Institute compiled by Mrs. Beal, dated October 1951.) It was accessioned on November 1, 1951.

creator.death_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
